title: Who’s in the cast of The Batman so far?
text:
The Batman is shaping up to have a pretty impressive cast (Pictures: Getty)

We already know who’s going to be our new Caped Crusader in 2021 – with Robert Pattinson being announced to fill Batman’s shoes in the upcoming The Batman.

And the cast has grown even more in recent weeks, with other big names signing on to join the former Twilight star in the superhero’s newest big screen outing.

But who will be starring with R-Patz in The Batman?

Read on for the latest casting announcements and news…

From vampires to bats (Picture: Rex Features)

Robert Pattinson

Robert Pattinson is trying his luck at yet another huge franchise.

From Harry Potter to Twilight, he’s carried some pretty hefty expectations on his usually-slouched shoulders, but Batman might be an altogether different role for the actor.

Speaking about it, he said his first time in the Batsuit was a ‘transformative experience.’

He told Variety: ‘You do feel very powerful immediately.’

Dano about you, but his casting seems like an inspired choice (Picture: DC, Getty)

Paul Dano

After Jonah Hill made headlines for passing on the project, it was reported that Paul Dano will be slipping into the slippery trickster role of The Riddler.

The Riddler, also known as Edward Nashton, is a criminal mastermind in Gotham City and adds riddles and puzzles to his schemes, leaving them as clues for the authorities to crack.

The character has previously been played by Jim Carrey, in 1995’s Batman Forever.

Will Zoe be the best Catwoman in hissssstory? (Picture: Getty)

Zoe Kravitz

Continuing her ascent to superstardom, fresh from her performance in Big Little Lies, Zoe Kravitz is our new Catwoman.

Previously told she was too ‘urban’ to be cast in the Dark Knight Rises, Kravitz has been welcomed into the litter by previous Catwomen Michelle Pfeiffer, Anne Hathaway and Halle Berry.

With her edgy style, her cool acting chops and her badass aura, she’s sure to make a purrrfect antagonist to Pattinson’s brooding Bruce Wayne.

She confirmed rumours of her casting in a very Zoe Kravitz way, replying to her step-dad Jason Momoa on Instagram.

She wrote: ‘Love that Aquaman and Catwoman spend the holidays together from now on.’

He’s taken down some bad guys in Westworld, now it’s Gotham’s turn (Picture: Getty Images for Disney)

Jeffrey Wright

Star of Westworld and The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Jeffrey Wright is no stranger to entering the big blockbuster arena.

He’ll be playing the tough, no-nonsense Commissioner Gordon – beleaguered police chief of gritty Gotham who brokers an uneasy truce with the Caped Crusader.
